trans-unit.source: Schedule recurring jobs in Azure Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Schedule recurring jobs in Azure Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: Use the Azure Mobile Services Scheduler to schedule jobs for your mobile app.
trans-unit.target: Use the Azure Mobile Services Scheduler to schedule jobs for your mobile app.

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to use the job scheduler functionality in the Management Portal to define server script code that is executed based on a schedule that you define.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to use the job scheduler functionality in the Management Portal to define server script code that is executed based on a schedule that you define.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the script periodically check with a remote service, in this case Twitter, and stores the results in a new table.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the script periodically check with a remote service, in this case Twitter, and stores the results in a new table.

trans-unit.source: Some other periodic tasks that can be scheduled include:
trans-unit.target: Some other periodic tasks that can be scheduled include:

trans-unit.source: Archiving old or duplicate data records.
trans-unit.target: Archiving old or duplicate data records.

trans-unit.source: Requesting and storing external data, such as tweets, RSS entries, and location information.
trans-unit.target: Requesting and storing external data, such as tweets, RSS entries, and location information.

trans-unit.source: Processing or resizing stored images.
trans-unit.target: Processing or resizing stored images.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial walks you through how to use the job scheduler to create a scheduled job that requests tweet data from Twitter and stores the tweets in a new Updates table.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial walks you through how to use the job scheduler to create a scheduled job that requests tweet data from Twitter and stores the tweets in a new Updates table.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial uses the third-party LINQ to Twitter library to simplify OAuth 2.0 access to Twitter v1.1.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial uses the third-party LINQ to Twitter library to simplify OAuth 2.0 access to Twitter v1.1.

trans-unit.source: APIs.
trans-unit.target: APIs.

trans-unit.source: You must download and install the LINQ to Twitter NuGet package to complete this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You must download and install the LINQ to Twitter NuGet package to complete this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the [LINQ to Twitter CodePlex project].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the [LINQ to Twitter CodePlex project].

trans-unit.source: 7.
trans-unit.target: 7.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer in Visual Studio, open the web.config file for the mobile service project, locate the MS_TwitterConsumerKey and MS_TwitterConsumerSecret app settings and replace the values of these keys with Twitter consumer key and consumer secret values that you set in the portal.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer in Visual Studio, open the web.config file for the mobile service project, locate the MS_TwitterConsumerKey and MS_TwitterConsumerSecret app settings and replace the values of these keys with Twitter consumer key and consumer secret values that you set in the portal.

trans-unit.source: 8.
trans-unit.target: 8.

trans-unit.source: In the same section, add the following new app settings, replacing the placeholders with the Twitter access token and access token secret values that you set as app settings in the portal:
trans-unit.target: In the same section, add the following new app settings, replacing the placeholders with the Twitter access token and access token secret values that you set as app settings in the portal:

trans-unit.source: The mobile service uses these stored settings when it runs on the local computer, which lets you test the scheduled job before you publish it.
trans-unit.target: The mobile service uses these stored settings when it runs on the local computer, which lets you test the scheduled job before you publish it.

trans-unit.source: When running in Azure, the mobile service instead uses values set in the portal and ignores these project settings.
trans-unit.target: When running in Azure, the mobile service instead uses values set in the portal and ignores these project settings.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer in Visual Studio, right-click the project name, and then select Manage NuGet Packages.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer in Visual Studio, right-click the project name, and then select Manage NuGet Packages.

trans-unit.source: In the left pane, select the Online category, search for linq2twitter, click Install on the linqtotwitter package, then read and accept the license agreements.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane, select the Online category, search for linq2twitter, click Install on the linqtotwitter package, then read and accept the license agreements.

trans-unit.source: This adds the Linq to Twitter library to your mobile service project.
trans-unit.target: This adds the Linq to Twitter library to your mobile service project.

trans-unit.source: Next, you need to create a new table in which to store tweets.
trans-unit.target: Next, you need to create a new table in which to store tweets.

trans-unit.source: In the Solution Explorer in Visual Studio, right-click the DataObjects folder, expand Add, click Class, type Updates for Name, then click Add.
trans-unit.target: In the Solution Explorer in Visual Studio, right-click the DataObjects folder, expand Add, click Class, type Updates for Name, then click Add.

trans-unit.source: This creates a new project file for the Updates class.
trans-unit.target: This creates a new project file for the Updates class.

trans-unit.source: Right-click References > Add Reference... > Framework under Assemblies, then check System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations and click OK.
trans-unit.target: Right-click References > Add Reference... > Framework under Assemblies, then check System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations and click OK.

trans-unit.source: This adds a new assembly reference.
trans-unit.target: This adds a new assembly reference.

trans-unit.source: In this new class, add the following using statements:
trans-unit.target: In this new class, add the following using statements:

trans-unit.source: Replace the Updates class definition with the following code:
trans-unit.target: Replace the Updates class definition with the following code:

trans-unit.source: Expand the Models folder, open the data model context file (named service_nameContext.cs) and add the following property that returns a typed DbSet:
trans-unit.target: Expand the Models folder, open the data model context file (named service_nameContext.cs) and add the following property that returns a typed DbSet:

trans-unit.source: The Updates table, which is created in the database when the DbSet is first accessed, is used by the service to store tweet data.
trans-unit.target: The Updates table, which is created in the database when the DbSet is first accessed, is used by the service to store tweet data.

trans-unit.source: When using the default database initializer, Entity Framework will drop and recreate the database whenever it detects a data model change in the Code First model definition.
trans-unit.target: When using the default database initializer, Entity Framework will drop and recreate the database whenever it detects a data model change in the Code First model definition.

trans-unit.source: To make this data model change and maintain existing data in the database, you must use Code First Migrations.
trans-unit.target: To make this data model change and maintain existing data in the database, you must use Code First Migrations.

trans-unit.source: The default initializer cannot be used against a SQL Database in Azure.
trans-unit.target: The default initializer cannot be used against a SQL Database in Azure.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>How to Use Code First Migrations to Update the Data Model</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>How to Use Code First Migrations to Update the Data Model</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Next, you create the scheduled job that accesses Twitter and stores tweet data in the new Updates table.
trans-unit.target: Next, you create the scheduled job that accesses Twitter and stores tweet data in the new Updates table.

trans-unit.source: Expand the ScheduledJobs folder and open the SampleJob.cs project file.
trans-unit.target: Expand the ScheduledJobs folder and open the SampleJob.cs project file.

trans-unit.source: This class, which inherits from ScheduledJob, represents a job that can be scheduled, in the Azure Management Portal, to run on a fixed schedule or on demand.
trans-unit.target: This class, which inherits from ScheduledJob, represents a job that can be scheduled, in the Azure Management Portal, to run on a fixed schedule or on demand.

trans-unit.source: Replace the contents of SampleJob.cs with the following code:
trans-unit.target: Replace the contents of SampleJob.cs with the following code:

trans-unit.source: In the above code, you must replace the strings todolistService and todolistContext with the namespace and DbContext of your downloaded project, which are mobile_service_nameService and mobile_service_nameContext, respective.
trans-unit.target: In the above code, you must replace the strings todolistService and todolistContext with the namespace and DbContext of your downloaded project, which are mobile_service_nameService and mobile_service_nameContext, respective.

trans-unit.source: In the above code, the ExecuteAsync override method calls the Twitter query API using stored credentials to request recent tweets that contain the hashtag #mobileservices.
trans-unit.target: In the above code, the ExecuteAsync override method calls the Twitter query API using stored credentials to request recent tweets that contain the hashtag #mobileservices.

trans-unit.source: Duplicate tweets and replies are removed from the results before they are stored in the table.
trans-unit.target: Duplicate tweets and replies are removed from the results before they are stored in the table.

trans-unit.source: Schedule jobs can be tested locally before being published to Azure and registered in the portal.
trans-unit.target: Schedule jobs can be tested locally before being published to Azure and registered in the portal.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, with the mobile service project set as the startup project, press F5.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, with the mobile service project set as the startup project, press F5.

trans-unit.source: This starts the mobile service project and displays a new browser window with the welcome page.
trans-unit.target: This starts the mobile service project and displays a new browser window with the welcome page.

trans-unit.source: Click try it out, then click POST jobs/{jobName}.
trans-unit.target: Click try it out, then click POST jobs/{jobName}.

trans-unit.source: Click try this out, type Sample as the {jobName} parameter value, then click Send.
trans-unit.target: Click try this out, type Sample as the {jobName} parameter value, then click Send.

trans-unit.source: This sends a new POST request to the Sample job endpoint.
trans-unit.target: This sends a new POST request to the Sample job endpoint.

trans-unit.source: In the local service, the ExecuteAsync method is started.
trans-unit.target: In the local service, the ExecuteAsync method is started.

trans-unit.source: You can set a break point in this method to debug the code.
trans-unit.target: You can set a break point in this method to debug the code.

trans-unit.source: In Server Explorer, expand Data Connections, MSTableConnectionString, and tables; right-click Updates and click Show Table Data.
trans-unit.target: In Server Explorer, expand Data Connections, MSTableConnectionString, and tables; right-click Updates and click Show Table Data.

trans-unit.source: The new tweets are entered as rows in the data table.
trans-unit.target: The new tweets are entered as rows in the data table.

trans-unit.source: The job must be registered in the Scheduler tab so that Mobile Services can run it on the schedule that you define.
trans-unit.target: The job must be registered in the Scheduler tab so that Mobile Services can run it on the schedule that you define.

trans-unit.source: Republish the mobile service project to Azure.
trans-unit.target: Republish the mobile service project to Azure.

trans-unit.source: In the [Azure Management Portal], click Mobile Services, and then click your app.
trans-unit.target: In the [Azure Management Portal], click Mobile Services, and then click your app.

trans-unit.source: Click the Scheduler tab, then click +Create.
trans-unit.target: Click the Scheduler tab, then click +Create.

trans-unit.source: When you run your mobile service in Free tier, you are only able to run one scheduled job at a time.
trans-unit.target: When you run your mobile service in Free tier, you are only able to run one scheduled job at a time.

trans-unit.source: In paid tiers, you can run up to ten scheduled jobs at a time.
trans-unit.target: In paid tiers, you can run up to ten scheduled jobs at a time.

trans-unit.source: In the scheduler dialog, enter Sample for the Job Name, set the schedule interval and units, then click the check button.
trans-unit.target: In the scheduler dialog, enter Sample for the Job Name, set the schedule interval and units, then click the check button.

trans-unit.source: This creates a new job named Sample.
trans-unit.target: This creates a new job named Sample.

trans-unit.source: Click the new job you just created, then click Run Once to test the script.
trans-unit.target: Click the new job you just created, then click Run Once to test the script.

trans-unit.source: This executes the job while it remains disabled in the scheduler.
trans-unit.target: This executes the job while it remains disabled in the scheduler.

trans-unit.source: From this page, you can enable the job and change its schedule at any time.
trans-unit.target: From this page, you can enable the job and change its schedule at any time.

trans-unit.source: A POST request can still be used to start the scheduled job.
trans-unit.target: A POST request can still be used to start the scheduled job.

trans-unit.source: However, the authorization defaults to user, which means that the request must include the application key in the header.
trans-unit.target: However, the authorization defaults to user, which means that the request must include the application key in the header.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) In the [Azure Management Portal], click manage for the database associated with your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) In the [Azure Management Portal], click manage for the database associated with your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: In the Management portal execute a query to view the changes made by the app.
trans-unit.target: In the Management portal execute a query to view the changes made by the app.

trans-unit.source: Your query will be similar to the following query but use your mobile service name as schema name instead of todolist.
trans-unit.target: Your query will be similar to the following query but use your mobile service name as schema name instead of todolist.

trans-unit.source: Congratulations, you have successfully created a new scheduled job in your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Congratulations, you have successfully created a new scheduled job in your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: This job will be executed as scheduled until you disable or modify it.
trans-unit.target: This job will be executed as scheduled until you disable or modify it.
